title: The 30 best Amazon Big Spring Sale deals under $30
snippets: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is currently underway and will run until Monday, March 31st. The sale features a wide range of deals that are available to all customers, not just Amazon Prime members. A comprehensive roundup includes over 100 deals on popular gear, and there is also a focus on offering low-cost alternatives for shoppers.
summary: Amazon's Big Spring Sale is happening now through Monday, March 31st, offering a broad selection of deals accessible to all customers, not exclusively Amazon Prime members. The sale includes over 100 deals on popular items, with an emphasis on providing affordable options for consumers.

title: Elon Musk’s xAI buys Elon Musk’s X for $33 billion on paper
snippets: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, has bought the social media platform formerly known as Twitter, now called X, in an all-stock deal. xAI is valued at $80 billion and X at $33 billion, with X carrying $12 billion in debt.
summary: Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, acquired the social media platform previously known as Twitter, now renamed X, through an all-stock transaction. xAI holds a valuation of $80 billion, while X is valued at $33 billion and has $12 billion in debt.

title: Microsoft tests Quick Machine Recovery to restore PCs that can’t boot
snippets: Microsoft has initiated testing for Quick Machine Recovery in its latest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653), aimed at enabling IT professionals to remotely recover Windows 11 devices that are unable to boot. This feature was first announced last year, following the Crowdstrike incident, as a measure to enhance device recovery capabilities.
summary: Microsoft has started testing Quick Machine Recovery in the newest Windows Insider Preview build (6120.3653) for Windows 11. This feature, designed for IT professionals, allows for the remote recovery of devices that can't boot. It was introduced as a response to improve recovery options after the Crowdstrike incident last year.

title: The Fitbit-to-Google account migration deadline moves to 2026
snippets: Google, which acquired Fitbit in early 2021, initially required Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google accounts by 2025. However, in a recent email to Fitbit users, Google announced it has extended this deadline to next year, allowing more time for the account migration process.
summary: Google has extended the deadline for Fitbit users to migrate their accounts to Google accounts until next year, beyond the initial 2025 deadline. This decision, communicated through an email to Fitbit users, allows additional time for the account migration process following Google's acquisition of Fitbit in early 2021.

title: The Trump administration could green-light deep-sea mining for the first time
